page.title: 04Northorpe: Population
page.content: A survey gives the population of Northorpe in Summer 1985 as 135 (60 male, 75 female) made up of: Under 5s 7 (2 male, 5 female),5-16 years 26 (10m,16f) 16+to21 years 16 (6m,10f) 21 to retirement (65 for men, 60 for women), 74, (35m,39f), of retirement age 12 (7m 5f). The population of Northope is less than a third that of Scotton's 469. It has a smaller proportion of under 5s than Scotton (roughly 1 in 20 compared with its neighbour's 1 in 12) and also fewer elderly people (Scotton figures here being boosted by 34 residents of Glebe House Rest Home). In both villages roughly half the people are between 21 and retirement and there is a healthy mix of age groups, though both could do with more young children. (See 2 entries Scotton Population, Block 04880399).
